intro: Daphnidium lancifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaf daphnidium, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
